pr_title: Support range header for s3 get object api

timeline.message: Support range header for s3 get object api

timeline.author: ZacBlanco

timeline.bodyText: I would make this constructor protected to prevent misuse, but still have available in tests.
timeline.author: ZacBlanco

timeline.bodyText: for completeness, should we add a test for prefixLength? e.g. bytes=100-?
timeline.author: ZacBlanco

timeline.bodyText: I recommend making all variables private final
timeline.author: ZacBlanco

timeline.bodyText:
instead of defining a boolean isSuffixLength, I think we can set either start or end to -1 to represent that they are unspecified, then just check for start < 0 to replace the isSuffixLength condition. This prevents misuse of the class or potentially specifying the wrong boolean parameter. We can add a private method for it.
private isSuffixLength() { mStart < 0; }
timeline.author: ZacBlanco

timeline.bodyText: as a defensive measure, I would use >= mUnderlyingLength in the case the logic (whether now or in the future) ever goes over the mUnderlyingThreshold
timeline.author: ZacBlanco

timeline.message: refactor: change constructor visibility and reduce redundant fields
